other_tests.findings: The gallbladder is distended, measuring up to 11.4 cm. There is a nonmobile shadowing stone at the gallbladder neck, measuring 2.5 cm. Positive sonographic Murphy's sign. There is no gallbladder wall thickening or pericholecystic fluid. There is layering sludge and a few small stones as well.
Exquisite tenderness to palpation in the RUQ, mild distension, no guarding or peritoneal signs, and no masses or hernias.
